page.title: 07CHURCHES
page.content: {HARDWICK VILLAGE The church in this old village is dedicated to St.Leonard, the patron saint of prisoners. Most of it was built in 1220 of rubble with a leaded roof. It has a priests door on which can be found three scratch dials. There were two bells at one time, but one has been sold. The other has been removed. It is a Church of England establishment, which will seat a congregation of 140. Services are held every fortnight. The vicar is in charge of two churches. The other one being in Mears Ashby. {The CHURCH OF ST.EDMUND CAMPION}is a Roman Catholic Church. It is a modern one and can be found at the junction of Kingsway and Henshaw Road, just off the main road to Northampton. On the adjacent site are the Catholic Infant and Junior schools of Our Lady's.
